id: MashableThis 4K-ready SD card by SanDisk is on sale for $250 off, bringing the price down to just $99
paragraph:
So you just got a new 4K video camera and you're on a quest to be the next Casey Neistat. Suddenly, you discover that the SD card you have can't save 4K video. What do you do?Since more and more devices are starting to upgrade to 4K, it's going to be important that your SD card can handle it. The average card just can't cut it in today's age of 4K cameras, TVs, and phones.That's where the SanDisk Extreme Pro 256GB SDXC comes in. Lucky for you, it's a whopping $250 off at Best Buy. The card normally goes for $349.99, but is right now on sale for only $99.99 — that's an incredible difference.At 256GB of space, you'll have plenty of storage to play with, especially if you're a photographer or vlogger. It can save up to 16,000 16MP pictures or over three hours of 4K video. (That's a lot.)Shop this deal while you can. SanDisk sales tend to go really fast, as we learned on Prime Day.
